author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Creates a new IAM user for your AWS account.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-user

commands.description: Retrieves information about the specified IAM user, including the user's creation date, path, unique ID, and ARN.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-user

commands.description: Lists the IAM users, returns all users in the AWS account.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-users

commands.description: Updates the name and/or the path of the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-update-user

commands.description: Deletes the specified IAM user. The user must not belong to any groups or have any access keys, signing certificates, or attached policies.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-user

commands.description: Changes the password for the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-update-login-profile

commands.description: Creates a new iam group.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-group

commands.description: Lists all the IAM groups in the AWS account
commands.name: aws-iam-list-groups

commands.description: Lists the IAM groups that the specified IAM user belongs to.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-groups-for-user

commands.description: Adds the specified user to the specified group.
commands.name: aws-iam-add-user-to-group

commands.description: Creates a new AWS secret access key and corresponding AWS access key ID for the specified user. The default status for new keys is Active .
commands.name: aws-iam-create-access-key

commands.description: Changes the status of the specified access key from Active to Inactive, or vice versa. This operation can be used to disable a user's key as part of a key rotation workflow.
commands.name: aws-iam-update-access-key

commands.description: Returns information about the access key IDs associated with the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-access-keys-for-user

commands.description: Lists all the managed policies that are available in your AWS account, including your own customer-defined managed policies and all AWS managed policies.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-policies

commands.description: Lists all IAM roles
commands.name: aws-iam-list-roles

commands.description: Attaches the specified managed policy to the specified IAM Entity.
commands.name: aws-iam-attach-policy

commands.description: Removes the specified managed policy from the specified IAM Entity.
commands.name: aws-iam-detach-policy

commands.description: Deletes the password for the specified IAM user, which terminates the user's ability to access AWS services through the AWS Management Console.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-login-profile

commands.description: Deletes the specified IAM group. The group must not contain any users or have any attached policies.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-group

commands.description: Removes the specified user from the specified group.
commands.name: aws-iam-remove-user-from-group

commands.description: Creates a password for the specified user, giving the user the ability to access AWS services through the AWS Management Console.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-login-profile

commands.description: Deletes the access key pair associated with the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-access-key

commands.description: Creates a new instance profile.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-instance-profile

commands.description: Deletes the specified instance profile. The instance profile must not have an associated role.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-instance-profile

commands.description: Lists all the instance profiles tin your AWS account.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-instance-profiles

commands.description: Adds the specified IAM role to the specified instance profile. An instance profile can contain only one role, and this limit cannot be increased. You can remove the existing role and then add a different role to an instance profile.
commands.name: aws-iam-add-role-to-instance-profile

commands.description: Removes the specified IAM role from the specified EC2 instance profile.
commands.name: aws-iam-remove-role-from-instance-profile

commands.description: Lists the instance profiles that have the specified associated IAM role.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-instance-profiles-for-role

commands.description: Retrieves information about the specified instance profile.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-instance-profile

commands.description: Retrieves information about the specified role.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-role

commands.description: Deletes the specified role. The role must not have any policies attached.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-role

commands.description: Creates a new role for your AWS account.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-role

commands.description: Creates a new managed policy for your AWS account.  This operation creates a policy version with a version identifier of v1 and sets v1 as the policy's default version.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-policy

commands.description: Deletes the specified managed policy.  Before you can delete a managed policy, you must first detach the policy from all users, groups, and roles that it is attached to. In addition you must delete all the policy's versions.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-policy

commands.description: Creates a new version of the specified managed policy. To update a managed policy, you create a new policy version. A managed policy can have up to five versions. If the policy has five versions, you must delete an existing version using DeletePolicyVersion before you create a new version.  Optionally, you can set the new version as the policy's default version. The default version is the version that is in effect for the IAM users, groups, and roles to which the policy is attached.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-policy-version

commands.description: Deletes the specified version from the specified managed policy.  You cannot delete the default version from a policy using this API. To delete the default version from a policy, use DeletePolicy . To find out which version of a policy is marked as the default version, use ListPolicyVersions .
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-policy-version

commands.description: Lists information about the versions of the specified managed policy, including the version that is currently set as the policy's default version.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-policy-versions

commands.description: Retrieves information about the specified version of the specified managed policy, including the policy document.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-policy-version

commands.description: Sets the specified version of the specified policy as the policy's default (operative) version.  This operation affects all users, groups, and roles that the policy is attached to.
commands.name: aws-iam-set-default-policy-version

commands.description: Creates an alias for your AWS account.
commands.name: aws-iam-create-account-alias

commands.description: Deletes the specified AWS account alias.
commands.name: aws-iam-delete-account-alias

commands.description: Get AWS account's password policy
commands.name: aws-iam-get-account-password-policy

commands.description: Create/update password policy
commands.name: aws-iam-update-account-password-policy

commands.description: Lists the names of the inline policies that are embedded in the specified IAM role.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-role-policies

commands.description: Retrieves the specified inline policy document that is embedded with the specified IAM role.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-role-policy

commands.description: Retrieves information about the specified managed policy, including the policy's default version and the total number of IAM users, groups, and roles to which the policy is attached.
commands.name: aws-iam-get-policy

commands.description: Lists the names of the inline policies embedded in the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-user-policies

commands.description: Lists all managed policies that are attached to the specified IAM user.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-attached-user-policies

commands.description: Lists all managed policies that are attached to the specified IAM group.
commands.name: aws-iam-list-attached-group-policies

commands.description: Retrieves the user login profile information for AWS management consle
commands.name: aws-iam-get-user-login-profile

integration.description: Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM)
integration.name: AWS - Identity and Access Management

playbook.description:
Enrich AWS IAM user information from AWS Identity and Access Management.
- List user access keys
- Get user information
playbook.name: AWS IAM - User enrichment

description: Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM)
name: AWS - IAM
